intro: Swynnertonia, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to southern Africa. The plants are characterized by their showy, yellow or orange flowers that resemble buttercups, and their palmately lobed leaves. Swynnertonia species typically grow in moist, shaded environments, such as forests or along stream banks. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their striking floral display.
